recipe.title: Classic Bento Box
recipe.description: A traditional Japanese bento box featuring rice, grilled fish, pickled vegetables, and a sweet tamagoyaki egg.
steps: 1. Cook the rice according to package instructions and let it cool.
2. Grill the fish fillet until cooked through and flaky.
3. Prepare the tamagoyaki egg by whisking eggs and cooking in a pan until set.
4. Arrange the cooked rice in one compartment of the bento box.
5. Place the grilled fish in another compartment.
6. Add the pickled vegetables next to the fish.
7. Slice the tamagoyaki egg and place it in a separate compartment.
8. Drizzle soy sauce over the rice.
9. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top of the tamagoyaki.

recipe.title: Chicken Teriyaki Bento
recipe.description: A delicious bento box featuring teriyaki chicken, steamed rice, broccoli, and a side of fruit.
steps: 1. Cook the rice according to package instructions and keep warm.
2. Marinate the chicken breast in teriyaki sauce for at least 30 minutes.
3. Grill or pan-fry the marinated chicken until cooked through and slightly caramelized.
4. Steam the broccoli until tender and vibrant green.
5. Arrange the steamed rice in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Slice the cooked chicken breast and place it next to the rice.
7. Add the steamed broccoli to a separate compartment.
8. Arrange sliced strawberries in a small section of the bento box.
9. Garnish with sesame seeds on the chicken.
10. Close the bento box and enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipe.title: Vegetarian Bento Box
recipe.description: A vibrant bento box filled with tofu, assorted vegetables, quinoa, and a tangy dipping sauce.
steps: 1. Cook the quinoa according to package instructions and keep warm.
2. Cut the tofu into cubes and pan-fry until golden brown on all sides.
3. Slice the bell peppers and shred the carrots.
4. Heat the sesame oil in a pan and sauté the bell peppers and carrots until tender-crisp.
5. Arrange the cooked quinoa in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Add the pan-fried tofu cubes to a separate compartment.
7. Place the sautéed vegetables in another section of the box.
8. Add a small portion of edamame to one side of the bento box.
9. Serve with a side of soy sauce for dipping.
10. Close the bento box and serve warm or refrigerate until ready to enjoy.

recipe.title: Salmon and Avocado Bento
recipe.description: A refreshing bento box featuring grilled salmon, sliced avocado, mixed greens, and a side of miso soup.
steps: 1. Preheat the grill or oven to medium-high heat.
2. Season the salmon fillet with salt and pepper, and grill until cooked through.
3. Slice the avocado and prepare the mixed greens.
4. Prepare the miso soup according to package instructions.
5. Arrange the grilled salmon fillet in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Place the sliced avocado next to the salmon.
7. Add the mixed greens and cherry tomatoes to another section of the box.
8. Pour the miso soup into a small, separate container.
9. Serve with a side of soy sauce for added flavor.
10. Close the bento box and enjoy the meal warm or store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.

recipe.title: Beef and Broccoli Bento
recipe.description: A savory bento box featuring tender beef slices with broccoli, jasmine rice, and a side of pickled ginger.
steps: 1. Cook the jasmine rice according to package instructions and keep warm.
2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and stir-fry the beef slices until browned.
3. Add oyster sauce and soy sauce to the beef, and cook until the sauce is slightly thickened.
4. Steam or blanch the broccoli until tender-crisp.
5. Arrange the jasmine rice in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Place the beef slices and broccoli in separate compartments.
7. Add pickled ginger to a small section of the box.
8. Close the bento box and serve warm or store in the refrigerator until ready to eat.

recipe.title: Pork Katsu Bento
recipe.description: A delicious bento box featuring crispy pork katsu, steamed rice, shredded cabbage, and a tangy tonkotsu sauce.
steps: 1. Preheat the oil for frying in a pan.
2. Coat the pork cutlet in flour, dip in beaten egg, and then coat with panko breadcrumbs.
3. Fry the breaded pork cutlet until golden brown and crispy, then drain on paper towels.
4. Slice the pork cutlet into strips.
5. Arrange the steamed rice in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Place the sliced pork katsu in another section.
7. Add shredded cabbage to a separate compartment.
8. Serve with tonkotsu sauce on the side.
9. Close the bento box and enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipe.title: Shrimp Tempura Bento
recipe.description: A delightful bento box featuring crispy shrimp tempura, soba noodles, and a side of dipping sauce.
steps: 1. Prepare the soba noodles according to package instructions and keep warm.
2. Mix tempura batter mix with cold water to make a batter.
3. Heat vegetable oil in a deep pan or fryer.
4. Dip shrimp in the batter and fry until golden brown and crispy.
5. Drain shrimp on paper towels to remove excess oil.
6. Arrange the cooked soba noodles in one compartment of the bento box.
7. Place the crispy shrimp tempura in another section.
8. Add a small container of tempura dipping sauce.
9. Close the bento box and enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipe.title: Spicy Tofu Bento
recipe.description: A flavorful bento box with spicy tofu, jasmine rice, sautéed vegetables, and a side of pickled cucumbers.
steps: 1. Cook the jasmine rice according to package instructions and keep warm.
2. Heat vegetable oil in a pan and cook the tofu cubes until golden brown.
3. Add spicy hoisin sauce to the tofu and cook until the sauce thickens.
4. Sauté the mixed bell peppers and mushrooms until tender.
5. Arrange the jasmine rice in one compartment of the bento box.
6. Place the spicy tofu in another section.
7. Add the sautéed vegetables to a separate compartment.
8. Include pickled cucumbers on the side.
9. Close the bento box and serve warm or refrigerate until ready to eat.

recipe.title: California Roll Bento
recipe.description: A sushi-inspired bento box featuring California rolls, edamame, pickled ginger, and a side of soy sauce.
steps: 1. Arrange the California rolls in one compartment of the bento box.
2. Add edamame to a separate section.
3. Include pickled ginger in a small container.
4. Serve with a side of soy sauce for dipping.
5. Close the bento box and enjoy the meal immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.

steps: 1. Preheat the oil for frying in a pan.
2. Coat the eggplant slices in flour, dip in beaten egg, and then coat with panko breadcrumbs.
3. Fry the breaded eggplant slices until golden brown and crispy, then drain on paper towels.
4. Arrange the steamed rice in one compartment of the bento box.
5. Place the crispy eggplant katsu in another section.
6. Add shredded cabbage to a separate compartment.
7. Serve with tonkotsu sauce on the side.
8. Close the bento box and enjoy immediately or refrigerate until ready to eat.
